SEARCH
Package VotingSystem

Class CPL

java.lang.Object
VotingSystem.Election
VotingSystem.CPL
public class CPL extends Election
CPL Election that can read in data from an ballot file, execute the CPL election algorithm, and output the results, all while writing to an audit file
Author:
Lane Enget, Pyrenees Gavois

  • Constructor Details

    • CPL

      public CPL(FileReader input, FileWriter audit, BufferedReader br)
      This is the constructor for CPL.
      Parameters:
      input - A FileReader that represents the election input file to process
      audit - A FileWriter that represents the audit file to write to
      br - Is the BufferReader that this class will use to parse the input file

  • Method Details

    • getVoteTotal

      public int getVoteTotal()
      Getter method for the total votes of the CPL election, primarily used for testing
      Returns:
      The int representing the total amount of votes

    • getTotalSeats

      public int getTotalSeats()
      Getter method for the total number of open seats of the CPL election, primarily used for testing
      Returns:
      The int representing the number of seats

    • getParties

      public Party[] getParties()
      Getter method for the array of parties, primarily used for testing
      Returns:
      The array of party objects representing all parties in the CPL election

    • processFile

      public void processFile()
      Processes the input file to count votes for each party and writes the record to the audit file
      Specified by:
      processFile in class Election

    • conductAlgorithm

      public void conductAlgorithm()
      Conducts main algorithm for CPL election, that is populating the parties with the seats they've earned
      Specified by:
      conductAlgorithm in class Election

    • parseHeader

      public void parseHeader()
      Parses the header of the input file and creates the parties and candidates internally, as well as stores other auxillary information like the number of votes and number of seats in the election
      Specified by:
      parseHeader in class Election

    • initializeParty

      public void initializeParty(String[] partyNames)
      Helper function for parseHeader(). This function initializes the party objects and party array.
      Parameters:
      partyNames - String[] that is an array of all the party names

    • printResults

      public void printResults()
      Function that prints results of the CPL election to the terminal. Will first show all the parties and how many seats they've won, then will show who exactly (candidate names) have won a seat and their associated party.
      Specified by:
      printResults in class Election
